text: Colubraria obscura is a species of sea snail, a marine gastropod mollusk in the family Colubrariidae. ==Description== The size of the shell varies between 25 mm and 60 mm. ==Distribution== This marine species has a wide distribution: Florida, USA, to Brazil; off Canary Islands, Cape Verdes, Angola, Mozambique; in the Mediterranean Sea; in the Red Sea; in the Western Indian Ocean. ==References== * Marais J.P. & Kilburn R.N. (2010) Colubrariidae. pp. 54–59, in: Marais A.P. & Seccombe A.D. (eds), Identification guide to the seashells of South Africa. Volume 1. Groenkloof: Centre for Molluscan Studies. 376 pp. ==External links== * * Category:Colubrariidae Category:Gastropods described in 1844 Category:Molluscs of the Atlantic Ocean Category:Molluscs of the Indian Ocean Category:Molluscs of the Mediterranean Sea
title: Colubraria obscura
